Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice with top of foot; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with two concentric added white bands encircling rosette with eight alternating added red and white petals; exterior reserved with one wide brown band on bowl and another at junction with foot.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis) (on the evidence of being included in Petrie 1886, pl. V.)
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 53)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 302, no. 1095)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1104) (phase 2)
